title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.37 - Submission of orders, judgments and decrees for signature
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.37 - Submission of orders, judgments and decrees for signature

State Regulations
(a) Proposed orders or
judgments, with proof of service on all parties where the order is directed to
be settled or submitted on notice, must be submitted for signature, within 60
days after the signing and filing of the decision directing that the order be
settled or submitted. (b) Failure to submit the order or
judgment timely shall be deemed an abandonment of the motion or proceeding
unless for good cause shown. (c) (1)

When settlement of an order or
judgment is directed by the court, a copy of the proposed order or judgment
with notice of settlement, returnable at the office of the clerk of the part in
which the order or judgment was granted, or before the judge if the court has
so directed or if the clerk is unavailable, shall be served on all parties
either: (i) by personal service
not less than five days before the day of settlement; (ii)
by mail not less than 10
days before the date of settlement; or
(iii)
by overnight delivery not less
than six days before the date of settlement. (2)

Proposed counter-orders or
judgments shall be made returnable on the same date and at the same place, and
shall be served on all parties by personal service, not less than two days, or
by mail, not less than seven days, before the date of settlement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
207.37

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
